N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6659.4 - Municipal program requirements

State Regulations
(a) A recreation program shall be related to
the health promotion and recreational needs of the elderly persons residing
throughout the municipality. In developing a recreation program, a municipality
shall consult the area agency on aging to ensure coordination with other
community-based services for the elderly. (b) A recreation program shall be directed by
an individual who, by training and/or experience, is qualified to organize and
operate the program. (c) A
recreation program shall be open to all resident elderly persons regardless of
race, color, creed, sex, disability, national origin, political affiliation or
other criteria that is not related to program operations. Activities shall be
organized to serve the maximum number of elderly persons in the municipality. Spouses of elderly persons and nonresident elderly persons may participate at
the discretion of the municipality, but not if their participation would
exclude resident elderly persons. (d) Resident elderly persons shall not be
required to pay a fee in order to participate in a recreation program. Participants may be given an opportunity to make voluntary contributions
(without coercion) to help defray program costs. No older person may be denied
participation in a recreation program because of failure to contribute. Resident nonelderly participants and nonresident participants may be charged a
fee. (e) A municipality may
directly operate its recreation program, may enter into arrangements to work
together on joint recreation programs with one or more other municipalities, or
may subcontract the program in whole or in part to one or more nonprofit
agencies. Nothing contained herein shall relieve a municipality sponsoring or
cosponsoring a recreation program from the responsibility to supervise program
contractors to insure that the program is being carried out in accordance with
all applicable program requirements. (f) The council may recommend to the director
additional requirements and procedures for recreation program
operations. Notes
